channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Long pot hole, 31st July
item.description:
I reported this pot hole on Saturday 29th July. Opposite Orchard Cottage. This is Not Hyde Lane, it's Brockhamton lane.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockhampton Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Obscured sign on Prestbury High street and the bank corner, 31st July
item.description:
This sign should be at right angles to the High street directing people down The Bank to the Church and the much valued Idsall drive Car Park.See 2020 and 2022 photos.Previously reported in summer 2020 when it became 'buried' in the trees.Simple maintenance job needed by landowner.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 32;34, High Street, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous pot holes getting worse Malleson Road, 31st July
item.description:
This long string of pot holes starts at the Malleson Road/A435 junction and runs along, worst on the Southern side, to beyond Lawrence’s Meadow. The road surface has become very poor over the years but with the two new developments and the replacement gas main work along the length it has now become dangerously and continuously damaged. The whole length needs total resurfacing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 69, Malleson Road, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping, 31st July
item.description:
Pile of wood & household rubbish in Gateway.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evesham Road, Swindon, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole, 31st July
item.description:
South bound m5 between jct 10 and 11, large pothole in lane 1. Scared the life out of us when we went over this. Had to check no car or tyre damage soon after.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M5, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
These trees and bushes appear to belong to the flats at number two Libertus Road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 279, Gloucester Road, Lansdown, Cheltenham

item.title: Tree branches blocking the pavement, 31st July
item.description:
Branches that appear to belong to 287, Gloucester Road are very low above the pavement and need trimming back

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 279, Gloucester Road, Lansdown, Cheltenham

item.title: Overgrown public right of way, 30th July
item.description:
Overgrown vegetation is preventing access along the public right of way just off The Wharf lane at Coombe Hill so is not safe for public walkers to use. This needs to be cut back as it is currently inaccessible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Wharf, Leigh, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Burnt out vehicle, 30th July
item.description:
Burnt out vehicle and fly tipped Mattress etc - could be a serious problem if someone sets it going again!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Coberley, Cotswold

item.title: Broken glass, 30th July
item.description:
Large amount of broken glass including shards on pavement and in grass. Please could you clean up? Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southfield Approach, Naunton, Cheltenham

item.title: Large pothole, 29th July
item.description:
Long pothole about 2 to 3 ft along side of road opposite Orchard Cottage.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hyde Lane, Swindon, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large deep pothole at the bottom of Kidderminster Road, 29th July
item.description:
There are potholes all the way up Kidderminster Road, the whole road surface is really awful and has been for months. There is a pothole at the bottom of the road which is larger and deeper than the others and catch people out as they come round the corner if they aren't aware it's there.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kyderminster Road, Winchcombe, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road closed but is it?, 28th July
item.description:
The signs showing road closed have now been there for a few weeks but the signs have blown down a few times and vehicles are going in and out at both ends of 7 bends. Which makes me believe the road is open but signs have just not been removed? Is the road closed or not if so can the signs be removed and the road shown as open again.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4079, Ashchurch Rural, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken fishing olatform, 28th July
item.description:
Needs repairing

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hudson Street, St Paul’s, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement almost completely mud, narrow tarmac only, 28th July
item.description:
I reported this before, but Gloucestershire HIghways have just got back to me and seem to think it's just a problem with the hedges. It's not - it's the state of the pavement as well, where the grass verge is now completely mud and large puddles when it rains and only a narrow bit of tarmac barely wide enough for one person to walk on. The pavement needs to be paved (as the name implies). It is not helped by cars parking on it at picking up time from Pittville School and making it even muddier. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, East Approach Drive, Cleevemount, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light change sequence to red is too fast, 27th July
item.description:
This is a 60mph road, yet the traffic lights change as though it were a 40mph road. 2 seconds on Amber before red forces you to stop dangerously quickly, just too fast a sequence that needs slowing down. I have reported this before in the past, it needs correcting.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Andoversford, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Signs can come down now, 27th July
item.description:
All the no parking notices have been vandalised and are now out of date. Thanks in advance for sorting this out.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Robert Burns Avenue, Benhall, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 x large holes in carriage way, 27th July
item.description:
The 2 x potholes have been there for at least a couple of months. They are equal distance between each other in correlation to vehicle wheels!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Montpellier, Cheltenham
